content:
# The attempt to insert coal into the furnace failed due to an issue with the `furnace_position` object being passed incorrectly. 
# It appears that the function expects an entity reference rather than a position.

# Let's retrieve the furnace entity directly from the entities list to correctly reference it for the insertion of items.
furnace_entity = get_entities_by_type(Prototype.StoneFurnace)[0]  # Get the first stone furnace entity.
print(f"Furnace entity retrieved: {furnace_entity}")

# Now we can insert coal into the furnace using the correct entity reference.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace_entity, quantity=5)  # Insert some coal into the furnace.
print(f"Inserted coal into furnace at {furnace_entity.position}.")
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")

# Now we will also insert iron ore into the furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace_entity, quantity=5)  # Insert iron ore into the furnace.
print(f"Inserted iron ore into furnace at {furnace_entity.position}.")
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")
